title: How to Make Old Fashioned Coffee Cake

steps.headline: Beat all the cake ingredients in a large mixing bowl until smooth with NO lumps
Divide the mixture evenly between 2X18  cm sandwich tins greased with butter.
Leave the cakes to cool for a few minutes then loosen edges and turn out on to a wire rack.
To make the frosting, add the butter and half the icing sugar and mix.
Add the dissolved coffee and beat until smooth.
Add the rest of the icing sugar and beat again.
Put one of your cakes on a big serving plate and cover with half the frosting.
Then take the other cake and put it on top.
Cover the top of your cake with the rest of the frosting.
Drizzle your melted chocolate on top.

text: Preheat oven at 180 °C (356 °F).  Beat all the cake ingredients in a large mixing bowl until smooth with NO lumps  Divide the mixture evenly between 2X18  cm sandwich tins greased with butter.  Bake for 20 minutes.  Leave the cakes to cool for a few minutes then loosen edges and turn out on to a wire rack.  Let it cool completely.  To make the frosting, add the butter and half the icing sugar and mix.  Add the dissolved coffee and beat until smooth.  Add the rest of the icing sugar and beat again.  Put one of your cakes on a big serving plate and cover with half the frosting.  Then take the other cake and put it on top.  Cover the top of your cake with the rest of the frosting.  Drizzle your melted chocolate on top.  Finished.
